title: The Peter Principle Revisited: An Agent-Based Model of Promotions, Efficiency, and Mitigation Policies
summary: The Peter Principle posits that organizations promoting their best performers risk elevating employees to roles where their competence no longer translates, thereby degrading overall efficiency. We investigate when this dynamic emerges and how to mitigate it using a large-scale agent-based model (ABM) of a five-level hierarchy.
